introduction: Pigs and Courgettes is a tale of three women who decide to take matters into their own hands. It starts with Jenny, a young and fragile looking woman, arriving at a pig farm run by two middle aged women, Lynne and Sue. Their eccentricity makes Jenny slightly bewildered but she soon starts to feel at home. She has run away from an abusive boyfriend Bill and taken a refuge. Meanwhile, Bill is desperately looking for Jenny. He is heartbroken and angry at Jenny's betray of leaving him. He is determined to get her back. She belongs to him. As Jenny starts to feel finally safe, Bill finds a map book and locates the page that has been open to. Bill is on his way to get his Jenny back. Will the two women protect Jenny from Bill? When Bill arrives at the farm, the two old women leave, giving him a chance to be alone with Jenny. She fights back but he is much stronger. As he has gotten hold of her, the two women appear out of nowhere and strike him down. As Jenny finishes him off, Bill ...
